input: Write a short biography of Bhuma Nagi Reddy.
output:
## Early life

Bhuma Nagi Reddy was born in 1929 in the village of Nagireddipalli in the Khammam district of the then Madras Presidency. He was the son of a farmer. He completed his schooling in the village and then went to Hyderabad to pursue higher education. He completed his B.A. and LL.B. from Osmania University.

## Career

Reddy started his career as a lawyer in Hyderabad. He was appointed as the Additional Advocate General of Andhra Pradesh in 1960. He was appointed as the Advocate General of Andhra Pradesh in 1962. He was appointed as the Solicitor General of India in 1964. He was appointed as the Attorney General of India in 1967. He was appointed as the Chief Justice of the Andhra Pradesh High Court in 1971. He was appointed as the Chief Justice of the Madras High Court in 1973. He was appointed as the Chief Justice of the Allahabad High Court in 197

input: Write a short biography of Arthur Ewert.
output:
### Arthur Ewert

Arthur Ewert (1884-1968) was a German-born American artist. He was born in Berlin, Germany, and studied at the Royal Academy of Art in Berlin. He immigrated to the United States in 1906 and settled in New York City. He worked as a commercial artist and illustrator, and his work appeared in magazines such as The Saturday Evening Post and Collier's. He also worked as a muralist and created murals for public buildings and institutions in New York City and other parts of the United States.

Ewert was known for his realistic and detailed paintings, which often depicted scenes of everyday life in New York City. He was particularly interested in capturing the energy and vitality of the city, and his paintings often featured crowds of people, street scenes, and buildings. He was also known for his use of vibrant colors and his attention to detail.

Ewert was a member of the American Society of Painters, Sculptors, and Gravers, and his work was exhibited at the Society's annual exhibitions. He also exhibited his work

MATTHEW PERRY

Matthew Perry was born in Newport, Rhode Island, on the 10th of April, 1794. His father was a merchant, and his mother was a descendant of the famous Governor Bradford of Plymouth Colony.

When he was a boy, Perry was sent to a school in Newport, and then to a school in New London, Connecticut. He was a good student, and he was fond of reading.

When he was sixteen years old, Perry went to sea. He sailed on a ship that was bound for China. He was a good sailor, and he was soon made an officer.

When he was twenty-one years old, Perry was made captain of a ship. He sailed to the East Indies, and he made many voyages.

Sila María Calderón (born 1952) is a Puerto Rican politician who served as the 11th Governor of Puerto Rico from 2001 to 2005. She is the first woman to have served as Governor of Puerto Rico.

## Early life

Calderón was born in San Juan, Puerto Rico. She is the daughter of former Governor Rafael Hernández Colón and his wife, the former María Eugenia Calderón. She is the sister of former Governor Pedro Rosselló.

## Career

Calderón was a member of the Puerto Rico House of Representatives from 1985 to 1992. She was a member of the New Progressive Party (PNP) and was the first woman to serve as President of the PNP.

### Governor of Puerto Rico

import math

input: Write a short biography of R. Selvaraj (politician).
output:
R. Selvaraj (politician)

## Early life

R. Selvaraj was born in 1950 in the village of Kallupatti in the Theni district of Tamil Nadu. He was educated at the Government Higher Secondary School in Theni and the Government College of Arts and Science in Coimbatore.

## Career

Selvaraj was elected to the Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly from the Theni constituency in 1996. He was re-elected in 2001 and 2006. He was appointed Minister of State for Rural Development in the cabinet of Chief Minister J. Jayalalithaa in 2011. He was re-elected to the assembly in 2016.

## Personal life

Selvaraj is married to S. Sivagami.

input: Write a short biography of Xi Jinping.
output:
### 1. 简介

Xi Jinping (習近平) is the current General Secretary of the Communist Party of China (中国共产党) and President of the People's Republic of China (中华人民共和国). He is the first Chinese leader to be born after the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949.

### 2. 生平

input: Write a short biography of Pallavi Joshi.
output:
Pallavi Joshi (born 1963) is an Indian actress. She is the daughter of the late actor Vikram Gokhale and the sister of the actor Rohini Hattangadi. She is best known for her roles in the films Sardari Begum, Khamoshi, and Damini.

## Early life

Pallavi Joshi was born in Pune, Maharashtra, India. She is the daughter of the late actor Vikram Gokhale and the sister of the actor Rohini Hattangadi.

## Career

Joshi made her film debut in 1986 with the film Sardari Begum. She then appeared in the films Khamoshi, Damini, and Khamoshiyan. She has also appeared in the television series Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii.

## Personal life

Joshi is married to the actor Vikram Gokhale. They have a son named Vivaan.

## External links

## Club career

### Early career

Nainggolan was born in Antwerp, Belgium, to a Belgian father and a Malaysian mother. He started his career with Belgian side K.V. Mechelen, where he made his professional debut in 2006. He was loaned out to K.V. Kortrijk in 2007, where he made 16 appearances and scored 2 goals.

### Cagliari

In 2008, Nainggolan signed for Cagliari in the Italian Serie A. He made his debut for the club on 21 September 2008, in a 2–1 loss to Udinese. He scored his first goal for the club on 11 January 2009, in a 2–1 win over Sampdoria. He finished his first season with Cagliari with 2 goals in 26 appearances.

input: Write a short biography of Klaudia Kaczorowska.
output:
### Klaudia Kaczorowska

Klaudia Kaczorowska (born 1981) is a Polish writer and translator. She is the author of the novel The Last of the Mohicans (2015), which was shortlisted for the Nike Literary Award in 2016. She has also translated works by American authors such as Toni Morrison, Alice Walker, and James Baldwin into Polish.

### Biography

Klaudia Kaczorowska was born in 1981 in Warsaw, Poland. She studied English and American literature at the University of Warsaw and later at the University of California, Berkeley. She has worked as a translator and editor for various publishing houses in Poland.

input: Write a short biography of Gopi Sundar.
output:
Gopi Sundar is an Indian music composer, singer, and lyricist. He is known for his work in Telugu, Tamil, Kannada, and Malayalam films.

## Early life

Gopi Sundar was born in a Telugu family in Hyderabad, Telangana. He completed his schooling at St. Ann's High School, Secunderabad. He then completed his graduation in B.Tech from Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad.

## Career

Gopi Sundar started his career as a music composer in 2005 with the Telugu film, Chakram. He then composed music for the Telugu films, Chandamama, Kotha Bangaru Lokam, and Kotha Bangaru Lokam. He then composed music for the Tamil film, Kedi. He then composed music for the Telugu films, Kotha Bangaru Lokam, and Kotha Bangaru Lokam. He then composed music for the Telugu films, Kotha Bangaru Lokam, and Kotha Bangaru Lokam.

input: Write a short biography of Diego Godín.
output:
Diego Godín (born 16 November 1986) is a Uruguayan professional footballer who plays as a centre-back for La Liga club Atlético Madrid and the Uruguay national team.

In this Spanish name, the first or paternal surname is Godín and the second or maternal family name is Fernández.

Godín began his career with Nacional, and made his professional debut in 2005. He spent two seasons with the club, winning the Uruguayan Primera División in 2005–06. In 2007, he moved to Villarreal, where he spent three seasons. In 2010, he joined Atlético Madrid, where he has since spent the majority of his career. He has won the La Liga title in 2013–14 and 2020–21, the Copa del Rey in 2012–13 and 2019–20, and the UEFA Europa League in 2011–12. He has also won the UEFA Super Cup in 2010 and 2018, and the FIFA Club World Cup in 201

### 1. Introduction

Joel Edgerton is an Australian actor, filmmaker, and writer. He is best known for his roles in films such as The Great Gatsby, Loving, and The Gift.

### 2. Early life

Edgerton was born in Blacktown, New South Wales, Australia, on June 23, 1974. He is the son of a police officer and a nurse. He has two older brothers, Nash and Sean, who are also actors.

### 3. Career

Edgerton began his acting career in the early 2000s, appearing in films such as The Square, The Rage in Placid Lake, and The Boys. He also appeared in the television series The Secret Life of Us and Love My Way.

In 2011, Edgerton made his directorial debut with the film The Square, which he also wrote and starred in. The film was a critical and commercial success, and won several awards, including the Australian Film Institute Award for Best Film.

DANIEL ALEXANDER CAMERON.

Daniel Alexander Cameron was born in the city of Washington, D. C., on the 12th of May, 1837. His father, Alexander Cameron, was a native of Scotland, and came to this country in 1820, and settled in the city of Washington, where he was engaged in the mercantile business. He was a man of great energy and enterprise, and was one of the pioneers in the development of the city of Washington. He was a man of great influence in the community, and was highly esteemed by all who knew him.

Daniel Alexander Cameron received his early education in the public schools of the city of Washington, and at the age of sixteen he entered the University of Virginia, where he studied for three years. After leaving the university, he returned to Washington, and engaged in the mercantile business with his father. He was a man of great business ability, and soon became one of the leading merchants of the city.

### Kathinka Pasveer

Kathinka Pasveer (1893-1983) was a Dutch artist and illustrator. She was born in Amsterdam and studied at the Rijksacademie van Beeldende Kunsten in Amsterdam. She was a member of the Amsterdamse Jongerenstichting (Amsterdam Youth Foundation) and the Amsterdamse Kunstenaarsvereniging Sint Lucas (Amsterdam Artists Association Sint Lucas). She was also a member of the Arti et Amicitiae in Amsterdam.

output:
Kiara Advani is an Indian actress who works in Hindi films. She made her acting debut in the 2014 film Fugly, and later appeared in the commercially successful films Machine (2017), Bharat Ane Nenu (2018), Kabir Singh (2019), Good Newwz (2019), and Shershaah (2021).

## Early life

Gallagher was born in New York City, the son of Mary Ann (née Cullen), a nurse, and Peter Gallagher, a physician. He has two brothers, Timothy and Paul, and a sister, Maureen. He is of Irish descent.

Gallagher attended the Loomis Chaffee School in Windsor, Connecticut, and graduated from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in 1977.

Rajoelina was born in Antananarivo, Madagascar. He is the son of a former mayor of Antananarivo, and he attended the Lycée de la Plaine in Antananarivo.

### President of Madagascar

input: Write a short biography of Juan Nepomucino Goetz.
output:
Juan Nepomucino Goetz (1884-1938) was a Filipino writer, journalist, and politician. He was born in Manila on 1884. He was the son of Juan Nepomuceno Goetz, a German immigrant who was a prominent businessman and politician. He was educated at the Ateneo de Manila University and the University of the Philippines. He was a journalist and editor of several newspapers, including the Manila Times and the Manila Bulletin. He was also a member of the Philippine Senate from 1916 to 1922. He was a member of the Liberal Party and was a supporter of the American colonial government. He was a prolific writer and published several books, including "The Philippine Revolution" and "The Philippine War". He died in Manila on 1938.

Kevin Anderson (born 18 May 1986) is a South African professional tennis player. He is a former world No. 5 in singles and a former world No. 1 in doubles. He has won 11 ATP singles titles, including the 2018 US Open. He has also won 11 ATP doubles titles.

## Early life

Anderson was born in Johannesburg, South Africa. He is the son of Kevin Anderson Sr. and Karen Anderson. He has a younger brother, Wayne, who is also a professional tennis player.

## Career

### 2005–2007: Early years

Anderson turned professional in 2005. He made his ATP Tour debut at the 2005 Johannesburg Open, where he lost in the first round to Wayne Odesnik. He made his Grand Slam debut at the 2005 US Open, where he lost in the first round to Marcos Baghdatis.

In 2006, Anderson reached his first ATP Tour final at the 2006 Johannesburg Open, where he lost to Wayne Odesnik.

Goldsmith was born in London, England, the daughter of Lady Annabel Goldsmith and Sir James Goldsmith. She has a younger brother, Ben Goldsmith, and a younger sister, Kate Goldsmith.

Goldsmith is a philanthropist and socialite. She is the founder of the Jemima Khan Foundation, which supports charities in Pakistan.

### Salome Maswime

Salome Maswime is a South African politician who is the current Member of the National Assembly of South Africa for the African National Congress. She is a member of the ANC's National Executive Committee.

### Early life

Maswime was born in the Eastern Cape. She attended the University of Fort Hare, where she obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1992. She then obtained a Bachelor of Social Science degree in 1994.

### Political career

Maswime was elected to the National Assembly of South Africa in the 2019 general election. She was re-elected in the 2021 general election.

### Personal life

Maswime is married to Mlungisi Maswime.
